image.altText: Two men being interviewed with a stone wall behind them

props.synopsis: Nationals WA have promised to get rid of stamp duty for first home buyers and spend hundreds of millions of dollars on "shelved" country health projects if elected into state government next year.

title.children: Nationals WA promise to abolish first home buyers' stamp duty, spend big on country health

image.altText: A man drinking a glass of red wine

props.synopsis: It has been more than a fortnight since William "Billy" Wadsworth drove away from a caravan park in Western Australia's Goldfields. The "affable" and talented dancer has not been seen since.

title.children: Grave concerns for 76yo Vietnam veteran missing in outback WA

image.altText: Two men in suits layered on a composite image of a youth prison

props.synopsis: The tragedy of WA's first recorded death in juvenile detention last year sparked a damning coronial inquest that showed how broken the system that locked up teenagers was. Yet 10 months later, here we are again.

title.children: There may be few votes in youth justice reform, but yet another child dead shows the time is now

image.altText: A rocky desert landscape.

props.synopsis: A fossilised tooth from the world's largest predator has been "chiselled" from a site on WA's World Heritage-listed Ningaloo Coast, angering scientists as well as the conservationist and writer.

title.children: 'Insta-bogans' endangering precious Ningaloo Coast, author Tim Winton says

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin clenches both fists and screams in delight

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin claims the biggest win of his career, defeating Novak Djokovic in four sets at the US Open to move into the fourth round of a grand slam for the first time.

title.children: Alexei Popyrin downs Novak Djokovic as young Aussie soars to new heights at US Open

image.altText: An older man wearing hi-vis coat smiles, photographed from the side, against a grey sky

props.synopsis: Scientists are concerned that a toxic herbicide widely used in Australian farming could be linked to the growing prevalence of Parkinson's disease. It sat on the regulator's shelf for review for decades, while the company manufacturing it worked to publicly discredit evidence that its product was harmful.

title.children: Parkinson's has been called the silent pandemic, and scientists believe a common farm chemical could be one cause

image.altText: A composite image shows headshots of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump

props.synopsis: As the energy around Kamala Harris's nomination settles and she emerges from her first real test, the strategy behind Republican attack ads becomes clear, writes Jade Macmillan.

title.children: As Kamala Harris emerges from a major interview, the Republican plan against her crystallises

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: West Australian local governments want to strengthen payment arrangements on regulated airline routes, after being left hundreds of thousands of dollars out of pocket when Regional Express (REX) went into voluntary administration.

title.children: WA local governments owed almost $1m after airline collapse

image.altText: Missy Higgins

props.synopsis: After two decades in the music industry, singer-songwriter Missy Higgins says she's never felt more vulnerable.

title.children: Missy Higgins on the moment her life 'burned to the ground'

image.altText: Damaged ship with mast down at port with a shipping container in the background

props.synopsis: Two people are injured following a collision between a large container ship and the Leeuwin training vessel at a Perth port.

title.children: Container ship smashes into Maritime Museum, training ship during sudden Fremantle wind gust, injuring two

image.altText: A wide view of the town of Marble Bar, Western Australia with rocky mountains in the background

props.synopsis: The mercury peaked at 39.7 degrees Celsius in Marble Bar on Thursday — the warmest August day and winter day on record for the town.

title.children: 'It's hotter than a snake's butt': Seven WA towns break winter heat records

image.altText: Bee on flower

props.synopsis: After four consecutive dry winters, beekeepers in Western Australia are warning of diminished hives and biodiversity loss as fewer flowers bloom and pollen dries up.

title.children: Honey supply under threat in Australia as native flowers fail to bloom

image.altText: Trump Cheng collage

props.synopsis: The Hong Kong billionaires who saved Donald Trump from bankruptcy have finally achieved what he could not: a piece of the Australian casino business.

title.children: 'Dangerous' Australian casino connections saved Donald Trump from ruin

image.altText: a man wearing glasses looking and smiling

props.synopsis: Internal emails reveal how the Liberal Party rushed to endorse more than 160 candidates in the days and hours before the party missed a critical deadline.

title.children: 'Extremely urgent': Emails reveal Liberal Party scramble before local council bungle

image.altText: A police officer with 'Polizei' patch on their back wearing a helmet with their back to camera.

props.synopsis: Three people are in a critical condition after allegedly being stabbed by a woman on a bus in the west German town of Siegen.

title.children: Five wounded in bus stabbing in Germany

image.altText: A group of dead fish in the water.

props.synopsis: More than 100 tonnes of dead fish have collected in and around the port of Volos in central Greece after a mass die-off linked to extreme weather fluctuations.

title.children: Dead fish fill Greek waterways after extreme weather causes mass die-off

image.altText: A young white boy running through a field after a young white girl

props.synopsis: There are two important questions confronting any parents with young kids: are you giving them autonomy and have you equipped them with the competence to be truly and safely independent?

title.children: A mum being reported to social services for letting her teen travel Europe is a sad sign of today's risk-averse parenting

image.altText: Protestors hold signs

props.synopsis: First came secret negotiations, then a site was chosen on the edge of a historic town. The townsfolk were enraged and the site was moved. More were enraged so it was moved again. Now a plan for a prison has officially been buried.

title.children: Site after site after site — how plans for a Tasmanian prison fell apart and left communities divided

image.altText: A man surrounded by media cameramen

props.synopsis: Doctor Mark Chavez has agreed to turn over his medical licence and enter a guilty plea in the case involving the fatal drug overdose of Friends star Matthew Perry.

title.children: Doctor charged in connection with Matthew Perry's death set to plead guilty

image.altText: Giant lanterns of creatures light the night.

props.synopsis: On the last day of winter in Australia, we look at the night festivals that carry communities through the coldest months with lantern and fire rituals carrying messages of hope, healing and connection.

title.children: From bonfires to Vikings, the night festivals that bring warmth to regional communities

image.altText: Woman with short hair with kids' art behind her.

props.synopsis: The number of people on Victoria's planned surgery wait list has fallen, but some patients are still waiting years for treatment.

title.children: Melbourne mother launches fundraiser to access private breast reconstructive surgery, after waiting almost two years for public treatment

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair in a black shirt kneeling in a field of sunflowers

props.synopsis: There have been multiple fatal crashes on the Bruce Highway this week. Experts say we must change our attitudes and behaviour.

title.children: Raina's heartfelt plea to drivers after losing her dad, best friend in road crashes

image.altText: Liam Gallagher leans with an arm slung over his brother Noel's shoulder.

props.synopsis: Oasis has issued a warning against resellers after some tickets were listed for thousands of pounds minutes after pre-sale.

title.children: Oasis issues warning after reunion tour tickets relisted for more than $11,000

image.altText: A mother and daughter stand on a school basketball court.

props.synopsis: With Western Australia home to some of the most isolated towns in the country, finding a suitable high school can take an emotional and financial toll on parents.

title.children: Rural areas struggle 10 years on from the year 7 school transition

image.altText: Woman with glasses smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Emma McKeon has opened up about her struggles with swimming, after announcing Paris will be her last Olympic Games.

title.children: Australia's most decorated Olympian Emma McKeon ponders life beyond the pool after announcing Olympic retirement

image.altText: three aboriginal women holding a photo of a respected elder woman

props.synopsis: These First Nation educators say the Australian schooling system is failing Indigenous kids. They're offering solutions — and are calling on governments to listen.

title.children: As education gap widens, First Nations educators say their communities have answers

image.altText: A composite image featuring photos of Peter Dutton, Anthony Albanese and Adam Bandt.

props.synopsis: The Greens and the Coalition seemingly have the government stuck in a game of piggy in the middle, desperately trying to catch the ball as it is thrown between its two major political opponents.

title.children: The government is stuck playing games that have little to do with running the country

image.altText: A man in an orange top and broad-brimmed hat carries a hoe while looking at a white wooden cross covered in flowers.

props.synopsis: When a hermit on an isolated island told Geoff Crow about a lonely grave marker for a Japanese pearl diver 50 years ago, it started a passion to keep the memories of tragic strangers alive.

title.children: From a little boy lost to a long-dead Japanese pearl diver, Geoff ensures strangers' lives are not forgotten

image.altText: Ryley Batt of Australia in action, chasing the ball in his wheelchair

props.synopsis: Following a loss on day one to Great Britain, Australia's wheelchair rugby team have bounced back to defeat the host nation in Paris, on a successful day for the Australian team, particularly at the velodrome.

title.children: Steelers keep medal dream alive with thrilling win over France, as Australia adds two more golds in track cycling

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: We asked you for tips on how to save money in the cost-of-living crunch, on everything from fuel, insurance, mobile phones to food and healthcare. This is what you told us.

title.children: From fuel and phones to food and insurance — tips and tricks to save money amid a cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: LGBT flag

props.synopsis: The government's pair of about-faces on the census has left residual frustration in its ranks.

title.children: Inside Labor's census wobble: How the government made an issue by trying to unmake it

image.altText: Kharkiv bomb attack

props.synopsis: Ukrainian authorities say five aerial guided bombs were used in the bomb attack, which targeted a high-rise building in a residential area of Kharkiv.

title.children: Russian bomb attack on Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv kills seven, including 14yo girl

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: Brazil has started blocking Elon Musk's social media platform X, making it largely inaccessible there on both the web and through mobile apps, following the billionaire's refusal to identify a legal representative in the country.

title.children: Brazil begins blocking Elon Musk's social media platform X

image.altText: Fireball burning from a Greek oil tanker in the Red Sea.

props.synopsis: The ship, which was attacked by Houthi rebels in the Red Sea, has been on fire for a week as officials try to recover the tanker and avoid an environmental disaster.

title.children: A burning tanker could be about to drop a million barrels of oil into the Red Sea
